shared_text:
Decatur High School, Decatur, TX
Yesterday at 9:36 AM ·

We are soooo excited to announce plans for the 2020 DHS Homecoming. Because of COVID-19 restrictions and guidelines, the celebration is going to look a bit different this year. But we promise it will be GREAT!

WHAT: 2020 Homecoming Reverse Parade and Pep Rally
WHEN: Wednesday, October 7 - 5:00 p.m. reverse parade; 7:30 p.m. pep rally
WHERE: Parade at DHS; Pep Rally @ Eagle Stadium
DETAILS: For the Reverse Parade, floats will be stationary and motorists drive through, with each of the parade entrants having their own space safely apart from each other. Spectators, will stay in their cars and weave around the route (down Carson Drive and around DHS).
Then later that evening, at Eagle Stadium, the pep rally will kick off at 7:30 p.m. Details are coming soon about the parade route and complimentary ticketing.

ATTENTION ALL 2020-2021 ATHLETES
It is time to complete online athletics forms! A few things are different this year due to COVID-19, see below:
Incoming 8th-12th graders:
1. Click here: https://decaturisd.rankonesport.com/New/NewInstructionsPage.aspx
2. Follow online instructions to complete forms
3. On the MEDICAL HISTORY form - If you check YES to any question 1-6, your athlete is required to get a new physical. If not, you do not need a new physical this year.
Incoming 7th graders, or anyone new to athletics:
1. Complete steps 1 and 2 listed above.
2. You are ALL required to have a new physical.
Remember that these forms and physical, if needed, are required before you can participate in ANY practice or athletic period.
It is the expectation of Decatur Athletics for this to be done prior to the first day of school, or by Aug 3 if you play volleyball or run CC.

Decatur ISD has been blessed for many years by two beloved educators who are retiring this year. Julie Britt says goodbye to teaching after 30 years. Larry Hicks leaves his position as an administrator and coach in DISD after 34 years.

We hope you enjoy your rocking chairs, although we don't see either of you sitting around a whole lot. Congratulations and many warm wishes for a happy retirement!
We will miss you,
Decatur ISD

Congrats to Hayden Hurst for being a Decatur Chamber of Commerce & Entegris/POCO Scholarship Recipient!!

Hayden Hurst will be attending Oklahoma State University in the fall to major in Aviation/Professional Pilot. Spreading God’s word is what brings him even more joy than flying. Hayden loves seeing how God works in the lives of young people and how He can direct their paths. His ultimate goal is to one day combine his love of flying and his love for the Lord. Aviation ministry is where he sees himself in the future.

Hayden will graduate ranked 3rd in his class. He was involved in the National Honor Society, National Spanish Honor Society, AP, and Honors classes. Hayden played also played Varsity Baseball. He was on the Student Council, a Renaissance Ambassador, KREW Group Leader, Summit Youth Group Leader, and is involved in NexTgen at First Baptist Church. Hayden loves to snow ski and kayak.

Griselda Galindo-Vargas is the new principal at Rann Elementary coming to Decatur ISD from Austin ISD, where she has served as principal of Brooke Elementary since 2013. Galindo-Vargas has worked in AISD since 2007 as a principal, assistant principal, and bilingual behavior specialist. She last worked in Decatur ISD from 2003 to 2005 as a bilingual diagnostician.

Galindo-Vargas earned a Bachelor of Science degree in Interdisciplinary Studies from the University of North Texas and a Master’s in Elementary Education from Texas Woman’s University.

She is a 1989 graduate of Decatur High School.

DISD Curbside Meals-To-Go is in full swing this week at the Multipurpose Building. Breakfast and lunch are offered 8 a.m.-1 p.m. Monday through Saturday. All students 18 and under are eligible for the meals.

Here's the EASY step-by-step process:

1. Pull up to the entrance of the MPB (located between the middle school and intermediate school). Look for the neon green sign next to the food cart.
2. A Child Nutrition staff member will come out to your vehicle to see how many children are being served (please have children present at the time of pickup)
3. Wait in the car. The staff member will bring your sacked meals outside your vehicle and place on the food cart
4. After the food is placed on the cart, you can exit your vehicle and pick up the food
5. Enjoy! The Child Nutrition staff has done an awesome job of preparing healthy, satisfying meals for your students.
